title_full:
Gloria de Oliveira & Dean Hurley

              —
              Oceans of Time
            
              (Sacred Bones Records)
label: Sacred Bones Records
description:
Lynch associate Dean Hurley joins forces with German-Brazilian artist Gloria de Olivera on this celebration of dream pop that sounds as if Angelo Badalmenti and Julee Cruise teamed up with the Cocteau Twins for a re-record of "Heaven of Las Vegas". Magical.

It doesn't take long for Hurley and De Olivera to emphasize their creative direction here; after a luscious... more

label: Young
description:
Twigs keep it light and frothy with a classy mixtape inc. cameos from The Weeknd, Pa Salieu, Shygirl, Jorja Smith and many more

Definitely more a mixtape than an album, ‘Caprisongs’ takes a more effortless and breezy approach than the more laboured album craft of her breakthru ‘LP1’ and the brooding ‘Magdalene’. Swaying between signature R&B and... more

label: Touch Sensitive
description: Sprawling and deliriously psychedelic collection of mostly unreleased work from French-Iranian punk-industrial-world music free thinkers Vox Populi! ​with a collection primarily pulling from their creative highpoint of 1986-1990, splicing together the sort of weird, killer gear you'd expect to hear on Stroom, Fonal, Freedom To Spend, Finders Keepers and Rune... more

label: Drag City
description:
Hot on the heels of last year's Sun Ra tribute "Switched On Ra", "Bajascillators" is a psychedelic synth-rich set from the Chicago trio that's lodged between early Stereolab and Laurie Spiegel.

Cooper Crain, Rob Frye and Daniel Quinlivan are back on the synth tip again with "Bajacillators", a squelchy four tracker that diverts the well-kneaded kraut-inspired... more

label: Smalltown Supersound
description:
Techno-pop shapeshifter KLO meets Lasse Marhaug for an absorbingly gauzy 3rd album of unbuckled structures and expressive sound design, marrying Celtic mysticism and industrial dream-pop experiments nodding to TG and Enya.

Five years since her eponymous debut of puckered dance-pop songs, KLO yields the loosest, dreamiest conception of her... more

label: RVNG Intl.
description: Berlin-based Colombian noisemaker Lucrecia Dalt ties off a blistering run of releases with her latest album proper, the follow-up to 2020's acclaimed "No Era Solida". Using Latin American rhythms like bolero, sasa and merengue, and singing in Spanish for the first time in almost a decade, Dalt brings contemporary speculative intrigue to elements all too often... more
